definition: (after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: The images of the ancient Confucianists were suave gentlemen with the integration of both fine in their hearts and in their appearance.
sentences.chinese: 古代儒者的形象定位是内外美统一的文质彬彬的君子。

sentences.english: At present, many anti-Confucians, Confucianism in total disregard of human nature that instinct.
sentences.chinese: 现在很多反儒者，认为儒家完全不顾人性的本能。

sentences.english: It demonstrated the internal demand of his being as a Confucianst in the modern society.
sentences.chinese: 这是他作为儒者在近代环境下的内在要求。

sentences.english: He is a famous Confucian, and has made intensive research of Confucian books.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位知名的儒者，对于儒家经典著作很有研究。

definition: Confucian school, founded by Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3] (551-479 BC) and Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3] (c. 372-c. 289 BC)
doctrine (esp. religious)/argumentation (in a speech or essay)
experienced scholar/old expert in the field
a sage/wise and holy man/virtuous ruler/Buddhist lama/wine
Confucian study of ethics/study of Daoism/school for Daoism in Tang and Song times/Daoist magic/another name for 理學|理学, rational learning of Song dynasty neo-Confucianism
